comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. In http://closure-compiler.appspot.com/home compile the below // ==ClosureCompiler== // @compilation_level SIMPLE_OPTIMIZATIONS // @output_file_name default.js // ==/ClosureCompiler== var \u0069\u0066 = 1; What is the expected output? var \u0069\u0066 = 1; What do you see instead? var if = 1; "if" is not a valid identifier since it is a reserved word, but \u0069\u0066 is a valid identifier. Try running the below in squarefree.com/shell/shell.html var \u0069\u0066 = 1; alert(window['if'])

Good catch, mike.

Yi would you mind taking a look?
Issue 493 has been merged into this issue.
It's fixed and will come with the next release.
This issue was closed by revision r1208.

When it comes to \u0069\u0066 being a valid identifier:

"A UnicodeEscapeSequence cannot be used to put a character into an IdentifierName that would otherwise be illegal."
  http://ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-7.6

"... it is possible to create Identifiers that unescape to a reserved word so long as at least one character is fully escaped."
  http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Web_ECMAScript#Identifiers

This additional assumption is not mentioned on
  https://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/wiki/CompilerAssumptions
and
  https://developers.google.com/closure/compiler/docs/limitations
